sourcesContent:
export const questionObj = {"Qtext": "

Consider the below figure. It is given that JI and KH are perpendicular to HI . If \(HK = 9 \) cm, \(IJ = 9 \) cm, and area of triangle ILJ is 150 cm\(^2\), then find the area of the triangle HLK .
\newline
tikzpicture{}
\newline

", "Steps": [{"id": "s1", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "In the triangles ILJ and HLK , we have 
\[
	\angle \input[s1v1]{} = \angle \input[s1v2]{}
\]
\[
	\angle ILJ = \angle HLK 
\]"}, {"id": "s2", "n_params": 3, "step_txt": "
From these two, we can write that
\[
	\Delta ILJ = \Delta \input[s2v1]{}\input[s2v2]{}\input[s2v3]{} 
\]"}, {"id": "s3", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
So, we can write that
\[
	\frac{\textrm{area of } \Delta ILJ }{\textrm{area of } \Delta HLK } = \frac{\input[s3v1]{}\input[s3v2]{} ^2 }{HK ^2}
\]"}, {"id": "s4", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
\[
	\Rightarrow \frac{\input[s4v1]{} }{\textrm{area of } \Delta HLK } = \frac{81 }{81 }
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow \textrm{area of } \Delta HLK = \input[s4v2]{} cm^2
\]
\newline

"}]} 

 export const resp = [{"data": ["I", "H"], "text": "$$\text{$\angle I = \angle H$, since they both are perpendicular to HI, and $\angle ILJ = \angle HLK$, since they are vertically opposite angles.}$$"}, {"data": ["H", "L", "K"], "text": " "}, {"data": ["I", "J"], "text": "$$\text{Since, the ratios of the area of similar triangles is equal to the square of the ratio of corresponding sides, therefore, $\frac{\textrm{area of } \Delta ILJ }{\textrm{area of } \Delta HLK } = \frac{IJ ^2 }{HK ^2}$}$$"}, {"data": [150, 150.0], "text": "$$\text{Putting the values and simplifying the values we get $$\textrm{area of } \Delta HLK = 150.0 cm^2$}$$ "}]
